data.title: Fix minor typos in naming
data.body:
This PR fixes the following spelling mistakes in naming:

- `nomalize_point` -> `normalize_point`
- `_texcordLocation` -> `_texcoordLocation`
- `_stencileStateManager` -> `_stencilStateManager`

Also the changeset doesn't break backwards compatibility.
Thank you for your time.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
fix the bug that ect1 texture lost on android
data.body:
the commit do the following things:
- reload ect1 related shaders when comes from background
- reload alpha texture when comes from background

data.title: [JSB] cc.eventManager:  event.getUserData() returns undefined for multiple listeners
data.body:
After upgrading cocos2d-x to the latest code in branch v3, the event manager doesn't work correctly.

**The problem**:  If two listeners are registered for the same event, the second listener callback to be called will always get `undefined` from `event.getUserData()`

**The reason**: In function `js_EventListenerCustom_create` (jsb_event_dispatcher_manual.cpp), the JS object for the event is removed by the statement `removeJSObject(cx, event);`. So in the next callback, the JS object for the event is recreated and the `_userData` property is missing.

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding & cocos_file.json automatically
Fixed variable order in initializer lists
data.body:
`cppcheck` is currently reporting wrong variable order in the initializer list of some constructors. On some cases this could cause wrong initial value assignment to these variables.

This pull request mitigates the following messages from `cppcheck`:
````
[cocos/network/HttpClient-android.cpp:89] -> [cocos/network/HttpClient-android.cpp:610]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'HttpURLConnection::_client' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[cocos/network/SocketIO.cpp:105] -> [cocos/network/SocketIO.cpp:88]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'SocketIOPacket::_endpointseparator' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[cocos/network/SocketIO.cpp:397] -> [cocos/network/SocketIO.cpp:349]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'SIOClientImpl::_uri' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[cocos/platform/android/CCDevice-android.cpp:74] -> [cocos/platform/android/CCDevice-android.cpp:142]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'BitmapDC::_width' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[cocos/platform/win8.1-universal/OpenGLES.cpp:27] -> [cocos/platform/win8.1-universal/OpenGLES.h:48]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'OpenGLES::mEglDisplay' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:358] -> [cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:295]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'MyXMLVisitor::_fontElements' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:287] -> [cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:266]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'Attributes::hasColor' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:288] -> [cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:264]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'Attributes::fontSize' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[extensions/Particle3D/PU/CCPUDynamicAttribute.cpp:174] -> [extensions/Particle3D/PU/CCPUDynamicAttribute.h:241]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'PUDynamicAttributeCurved::_spline' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[extensions/Particle3D/PU/CCPUDynamicAttribute.cpp:175] -> [extensions/Particle3D/PU/CCPUDynamicAttribute.h:237]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'PUDynamicAttributeCurved::_range' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[templates/cpp-template-default/proj.win10/App/Cocos2dEngine/OpenGLES.cpp:27] -> [templates/cpp-template-default/proj.win10/App/Cocos2dEngine/OpenGLES.h:48]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'OpenGLES::mEglDisplay' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[templates/cpp-template-default/proj.win8.1-universal/App.Shared/OpenGLES.cpp:27] -> [templates/cpp-template-default/proj.win8.1-universal/App.Shared/OpenGLES.h:48]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'OpenGLES::mEglDisplay' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[templates/js-template-default/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.win8.1-universal/App.Shared/OpenGLES.cpp:27] -> [templates/js-template-default/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.win8.1-universal/App.Shared/OpenGLES.h:48]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'OpenGLES::mEglDisplay' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[templates/lua-template-default/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.win32/SimulatorWin.cpp:117] -> [templates/lua-template-default/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.win32/SimulatorWin.h:30]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'SimulatorWin::_hwnd' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[tools/simulator/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.win32/SimulatorWin.cpp:138] -> [tools/simulator/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.win32/SimulatorWin.h:30]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'SimulatorWin::_hwnd' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[tools/simulator/libsimulator/lib/PlayerTaskServiceProtocol.cpp:63] -> [tools/simulator/libsimulator/lib/PlayerTaskServiceProtocol.h:46]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'PlayerTask::_lifetime' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
[tools/simulator/libsimulator/lib/platform/win32/PlayerWin.cpp:10] -> [tools/simulator/libsimulator/lib/platform/win32/PlayerWin.h:34]: (style, inconclusive) Member variable 'PlayerWin::_menuService' is in the wrong place in the initializer list.
````

data.title: Exclude fps images from library (.so) in release build
data.body:
Android library in release mode contain fps images (array with png fps image).
Add define flag to  cc config to use fps images functionality, if not def strip all functions and array for fps functionality.

nm output the last big one entry (28127 is the size):
05060136 00028127 D cc_fps_images_png

data.title: CCNode::visit - Performance issue for pushMatrix
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.3 and 3.14
- devices test on: Iphone 5
- developing environments
   - Xcode version: 7.3.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a scene with many many nodes ( about 2000 ).
2. Use instruments to profile the scene.
3. About 3-4% of the cpu is used to do the pushmatrix stack operations, although I could not find why this operation is still required. I noticed because the code has a comment saying that the functionality it's actually deprecated, but the code is still there, running, wasting cpu cycles.

"// IMPORTANT:
    // To ease the migration to v3.0, we still support the Mat4 stack,
    // but it is deprecated and your code should not rely on it"

4. See images below for comparison with this code running or commented.

![screen shot 2017-02-03 at 12 06 22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25527653/22589295/e05d91cc-ea09-11e6-93d1-9c2e06052f8e.png)
![screen shot 2017-01-30 at 11 28 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25527653/22589299/e478210a-ea09-11e6-8d23-d5b03aa9ae3a.png)
![screen shot 2017-01-30 at 11 32 42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25527653/22589302/e66922ac-ea09-11e6-8dfb-49437f3fd826.png)

data.title: cocos2d::Label wrong texture offset after update font size
Add setting for default value to enable antialias
data.body:
I developed a retro-styled game. So I'd like to disable antialias when I scale textures.

I added the setting whether to enable antialias for all textures.

```cpp
// Disable antialias for all textures
Texture2D::setDefaultAntialiasEnabled(false);
```

Could you review this? ðŸ™‡ 

![antialias](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/147051/22553123/f329de20-e99e-11e6-817f-b2a66f454eb5.png)

data.title: Update flatbuffers to v1.5
data.body:
Update flatbuffers to the latest version (1.5) please, now we have initial 1.0 release.

Lots of features added, for anyone big time saver.
- can read, write json, populate c++ generated objects from binary or json, send messages to server and all generated from simple fbs schema
- Object API read & write to generated C++ objects.
- php, java support easy server client message interchange with verification
- mutation support

Thank you

data.title: Invalid write of size 4 in cocos2d::BitmapDC::getBitmap(...)
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1
- devices test on: Lenovo B590, Arch Linux

When running my app on Linux using valgrind I get "Invalid write of size 4" error.

CCDevice-linux.cpp:264: `*(int*) &_data[(iY + iX) * 4 + 0] = iTemp;`

The `_data` array is indexed using negative index. This is because `iY` is negative. `iY` is negative because `yoffset` is negative. And `yoffset` is negative because `computeLineStartY(...)` uses `face->size->metrics.ascender` for computing line height and font `ascender` is not guaranteed to be bigger than `horiBearingY`, which is later subtracted from `ascender` to get `yoffset`. In my case `face->size->metrics.ascender` is 2240 and `face->glyph->horiBearingY` is 2304, which leads to `yoffset` of -1.

fontfile: "/usr/share/fonts/OTF/NimbusSans-Regular.otf".
text: "Quit"

data.title: Get device's RAM memory or device's spare RAM memory
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13

Is there a way to get the device's RAM memory?

Our game consumes up to 1Gb of RAM memory with animations, sounds, movements, etc and we would like to check if the device can handle them to load the animations or not...


Thanks.

data.title: Sprites with ETC1 with alpha texture loses shader after restore from background.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1
- devices test on: Samsung TAB A
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e (64-bit)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch game with sprites use etc1 with alpha textures.
2. Game should have button to launch another app, let say open browser.
3. Launch other application using button
4. Restore game from background
 Expected result: all sprites lost shader and transparency as well

data.title: Particles don't stick to node to which they were attached
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.10 - 3.14.1
- devices test on: iPhone 6s plus Galaxy 6s

Lets say we have a scroll view and we have added 10 images to it. Than we add snow particles to image5. the Snow particle since they are flowing will move with the movements of scroll view. But they should stay attached to the image node 5. of course the source stays attached to image5 but particle move around.

data.title: Avoid variable shadowing
data.body:
I get the following warning message when compiling libcocos2d Mac/iOS with Xcode 8.2.1:

```
cocos/3d/CCSprite3D.cpp:219:29: warning: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
        for (ssize_t i = 0, size = _meshes.size(); i < size; ++i) {
                            ^
cocos/3d/CCSprite3D.cpp:202:14: note: previous declaration is here
        auto size = spritedata->nodedatas->nodes.size();
             ^
```

This patch replaces the variable `size` with `singleSprite` at line 202 and 207 to avoid the variable shadowing.

data.title: Cannot agree to Cocos License in an automated fashion
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1 (but previous versions as well)

When the usage/data collection is shown you must select Y or N. This is a manual selection. There is not a __flag__ one can pass to accept the license agreement automatically. This is handy for those running build servers.

You can modify __.cocos/local_cfg.json__ and set: __"agreement_shown": true__ but a __flag__ would be nice. Some users running build servers have brought this issue up on social media.

data.title: Androids 1671
data.body:
[](https://lumoslabs.atlassian.net/browse/ANDROIDS-1671)

Rendering of the first OpenGL surface frame on Android N happens before the activity layout is drawn, taking several seconds and blocks the inflation of the native Android layout containing the progress animation. 

Simply skip rendering of the first frame, allowing the activity to inflate and hook the callback to stop to close the native activity contents to the second frame.

data.title: js-tests application: SpiderMonkey crashes after EGL Context Lost
data.body:
- cocos2d-js version: 3.10
- devices test on: Galaxy Tab A, LG G4 Beat 
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10e
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

After a long debug process, I noticed that it happens always after glsurface calls onSurfaceCreated on the second time, (and a new GLThread is created, I print the GLThread ID, and notice that it changes).

After it happens, the application crashes at the first call to SpiderMonkey function, in my case, at AppDelegate.cpp:

void AppDelegate::applicationWillEnterForeground() {
    ....
    // Crash HERE!
    director->getEventDispatcher()->dispatchCustomEvent("game_on_show");
}

From Android Documentation: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/opengl/GLSurfaceView.Renderer.html

> EGL Context Lost
There are situations where the EGL rendering context will be lost. This typically happens when device wakes up after going to sleep. When the EGL context is lost, all OpenGL resources (such as textures) that are associated with that context will be automatically deleted. In order to keep rendering correctly, a renderer must recreate any lost resources that it still needs. The onSurfaceCreated(GL10, EGLConfig) method is a convenient place to do this.

Steps to Reproduce:
The issue is also reproduce randomly!
But the easiest way to force the crash:
Somehow those steps forcing the GLThread to recreate:
1. Launch from "Open" button at Play Store
2. Minimize app (pause)
3. Relaunch (resume) it again from the icon

Update:
I compiled the js-tests, same issue apear there.

data.title: Make extensions work out of the box in Linux
data.body:
`extensions/GUI/CCControlExtension/CCControlStepper.h` contains the [line](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/extensions/GUI/CCControlExtension/CCControlStepper.h#L33):
````cpp
#include "extensions/ExtensionExport.h"
````
and `extensions/assets-manager/Manifest.h` contains the [line](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/extensions/assets-manager/Manifest.h#L37):
````cpp 
#include "json/document-wrapper.h"
````

These two headers, along with other files under the `extensions` directory assume that `${COCOS2D_ROOT}` and `${COCOS2D_ROOT}/external`, respectively, are in included in the list of paths used by the compiler when it searches for headers, but this is not reflected in `CMakeLists.txt` for Linux.

I think we should include these paths by default.

data.title: Fix typo in AudioState
data.body: Hello, I found a small mistake in the `AudioState` enum class and renamed it `INITIALZING` to `INITIALIZING`.

data.title: libwebsocket with openssl rejected by apple for using non-public API
data.body:
I was trying to upgrade libwebsockets (2.1.0) with ssl supported which I downloaded from cocos 3rd party github and using it in my project which is using cocos2d-x 3.8.1. It built and ran successfully in our development environment, but when submitting to Apple to be reviewed, it was rejected because the following reason:

Non-public API usage:

The app references non-public symbols in <our-project-name>: _getcontext, _makecontext, _setcontext

I had to revert back to libwebsockets (1.6.0) without ssl and submitted again. Everything was fine after that. Please help me check if libwebsocket (2.1.0) or openssl use those non-public api or not.

Thanks!

data.title: Cocos2dx pre-defined uniforms cause shader link failure on some Mali GPUs
data.body:
Cocos2dx adds these uniforms to all vertex and fragment shaders:
```
static const char * COCOS2D_SHADER_UNIFORMS =
        "uniform mat4 CC_PMatrix;\n"
        "uniform mat4 CC_MVMatrix;\n"
        "uniform mat4 CC_MVPMatrix;\n"
        "uniform mat3 CC_NormalMatrix;\n"
        "uniform vec4 CC_Time;\n"
        "uniform vec4 CC_SinTime;\n"
        "uniform vec4 CC_CosTime;\n"
        "uniform vec4 CC_Random01;\n"
        "uniform sampler2D CC_Texture0;\n"
        "uniform sampler2D CC_Texture1;\n"
        "uniform sampler2D CC_Texture2;\n"
        "uniform sampler2D CC_Texture3;\n"
        "//CC INCLUDES END\n\n";
```
These definitions do not specify precision, which makes them highp in vertex shaders and mediump in fragment shaders. Because the code does:

`        (type == GL_VERTEX_SHADER ? "precision highp float;\n precision highp int;\n" : "precision mediump float;\n precision mediump int;\n"),
`

While this works fine on most devices it fails for some GPUs and devices because the GLSL spec says that uniform precisions in vertex and fragment shaders should match. Check this issue in another github project that discusses this part of GLSL spec:
  https://github.com/AnalyticalGraphicsInc/cesium/issues/817

> Do precision qualifiers for uniforms need to match?
> Option 1: Yes.
> Uniforms are defined to behave as if they are using the same storage in the vertex and fragment processors and may be implemented this way.
> If uniforms are used in both the vertex and fragment shaders, developers should be warned if the precisions are different. Conversion of precision should never be implicit.
> Option 2: No.
> Uniforms may be used by both shaders but the same precision may not be available in both so there is a justification for allowing them to be different.
> Using the same uniform in the vertex and fragment shaders will always require the precision to be specified in the vertex shader (since the default precision is highp). This is an unnecessary burden on developers.
> RESOLUTION: Yes, precision qualifiers for uniforms must match.
> 

**A possible solution:**

Can we just define all these uniforms to be mediump? Or are they likely to need highp precision in some uses cases?

```
static const char * COCOS2D_SHADER_UNIFORMS =
        "uniform mediump mat4 CC_PMatrix;\n"
        "uniform mediump mat4 CC_MVMatrix;\n"
        "uniform mediump mat4 CC_MVPMatrix;\n"
        "uniform mediump mat3 CC_NormalMatrix;\n"
        "uniform mediump vec4 CC_Time;\n"
        "uniform mediump vec4 CC_SinTime;\n"
        "uniform mediump vec4 CC_CosTime;\n"
        "uniform mediump vec4 CC_Random01;\n"
        "uniform sampler2D CC_Texture0;\n"
        "uniform sampler2D CC_Texture1;\n"
        "uniform sampler2D CC_Texture2;\n"
        "uniform sampler2D CC_Texture3;\n"
        "//CC INCLUDES END\n\n";

```

I started a discussion on this on Mali forums:
  https://community.arm.com/graphics/f/discussions/150/this-very-simple-shader-fails-to-link-on-only-some-mali-gpus/187

Another post discussing this issue with Mali GPUs and suggesting a #ifndef condition as solution. We need to consider this only if the cocos2dx uniforms are likely to benefit from highp precision: 
  http://ramisantina.com/blog/2013/06/mediump-vs-highp-precision-on-embedded-gpus/
```
//declared in vertex shader
#ifndef GL_FRAGMENT_PRECISION_HIGH
precision mediump float;
precision mediump int;
#else
precision highp float;
precision highp int;
#endif
```

Some of the GPUs which fail: Mali-T624, Mali-T628, Mali-T720, Mali-T760 and Mali-T860.

Some of the Android devices which fail: Aqua 4G+, SM-J120A, SM-J200M, SM-T800, CP8298_I00, CRR-L09, E5506, F3216, F670S, P1ma40, SM-G903W, SM-G920P, SM-J120A, SM-J200GU, SM-J200M, SM-J700F, SM-J700M, TAB 2 A8-50F, Z820, SM-A510F

It is interesting that shaders work fine on some devices with these same GPUs and fail to link on other devices with same GPUs, I guess it could be due to different GPU driver versions etc...

Cocos2dx 3.13.1
@minggo @ricardoquesada

data.title: Background sprite not resizing on UI button
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1
- devices test on: win32, xiaomi redmi 1s, moto g 2
- developing environments:
   - NDK version: 12b
   - VS version: 2015 community

Steps to Reproduce:

I've copied code from [cocos2d-X wiki](http://www.cocos2d-x.org/wiki/Widget) to generate a Text Button scale9 render. Resizing using setSize() worked fine with 3.13.1 but with 3.14.1, I get a deprecated warning , advising me to use setContentSize(), but doing so button's background sprite stopped resizing. Now it only changes it's location based on ContentSize.

data.title: Fix implicit conversion warnings
data.body:
Hello, I get the following warnings when building libcocos2d Mac on Xcode 8.2.1.

```
cocos/2d/CCParticleBatchNode.cpp:274:33: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'ssize_t' (aka 'long') to 'int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
cocos/3d/CCMeshSkin.cpp:92:28: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'ssize_t' (aka 'long') to 'int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
cocos/3d/CCSkeleton3D.cpp:306:28: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'ssize_t' (aka 'long') to 'int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
cocos/network/SocketIO.cpp:466:37: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'size_type' (aka 'unsigned long') to 'unsigned int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
```

This patch fixes them. Thanks!

data.title: Fix typo in function name
data.body: This PR just fixes a small typo in Lua bindings: `register_ui_moudle` -> `register_ui_module`.

data.title: Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) between onStop() and onCreate() caused by Label::setTTFConfig

   - NDK version:
